coding_practice.title: Patching Array
coding_practice.description:
Given a sorted integer array nums and an integer n, add/patch elements to the array such that any number in the range [1, n] inclusive can be formed by the sum of some elements in the array.

Return the minimum number of patches required.

examples.explanation:
Combinations of nums are [1], [3], [1,3], which form possible sums of: 1, 3, 4.
Now if we add/patch 2 to nums, the combinations are: [1], [2], [3], [1,3], [2,3], [1,2,3].
Possible sums are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, which now covers the range [1, 6].
So we only need 1 patch.

coding_practice.constraints:
1 <= nums.length <= 1000
1 <= nums[i] <= 10^4
nums is sorted in ascending order.
1 <= n <= 2^31 - 1
coding_practice.explanation:
1. 使用變數 miss 表示當前無法覆蓋的最小數字。
2. 遍歷 nums，若 nums[i] <= miss，則可以覆蓋 miss，更新 miss += nums[i]。
3. 否則，需要添加一個數字 miss，更新 miss += miss 並增加 patches。
4. 重複直到 miss > n，返回 patches 作為最少補充數量。
